title: Sisterhood, Interrupted: From Radical Women to Grrls Gone Wild
description: Contrary to clich√©s about the end of feminism, Deborah Siegel argues that younger women are not abandoning the movement but reinventing it. After forty years, is feminism today a culture, or a cause? A movement for personal empowerment, or broad-scale social change? Have women achieved equality, or do we still have a long way to go?
author: Deborah Siegel
